posts.cooked:
Signal Messenger

Introducing Signal Secure Backups

In the past, if you broke or lost your phone, your Signal message history was gone. This has been a challenge for people whose most important conversations happen on Signal. Think family photos, sweet messages, important documents, or anything else...

Mastodon ‚Äì 8 Sep 25

Signal (@signalapp@mastodon.world)

Until now, if you lost or broke your phone, your Signal message history was gone, a real challenge for everyone whose most important conversations happen in Signal. So, with careful design & development, we‚Äôre rolling out opt-in secure backups....

Bluesky Social ‚Äì 8 Sep 25

Signal (@signal.org)

Until now, if you lost or broke your phone, your Signal message history was *gone,* a real challenge for everyone whose most important conversations happen in Signal. So, with careful design and development, we‚Äôre rolling out opt-in secure backups....

posts.cooked: Okay, having seen screenshots that mention that the paid tier helps support Signal: who else thinks that there should be a ‚Äúpaid back-ups‚Äù badge in addition to the existing donation badges?

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: Paying for backups isn‚Äôt a donation, so it doesn‚Äôt really fit.
The ‚Äúthanks for supporting Signal‚Äù in the description that I saw in the screenshot suggests that there is at least a bit of margin in the price structure of the paid tier .

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: After the Google tax it‚Äôs ~$1.40 earned revenue per transaction. It‚Äôs a little bit more until the first $1M made.

Avitus:

~$1.40 earned revenue per transaction

I wonder how much of that goes to paying for the actual storage they use and how much would be left.
It‚Äôs based on Cloudflare R2: Pricing ¬∑ Cloudflare R2 docs . Would be 1.5$ for 100 GB excluding ingress frees so they either have a deal with them of assume most people won‚Äôt fill the storage.

DonDino:

I wonder how much of that goes to paying for the actual storage they use and how much would be left.

Probably a lot left over, because running a business is expensive! The fully allocated cost of backups alone also includes the employee time (salary and benefits) to design, develop, market, and support the feature across all platforms, develop the additional backup features which are on the roadmap, the increased bandwidth costs, any increased server load, etc. If there‚Äôs some margin above all that to go towards supporting the rest of the business that‚Äôs quite all right with me as well.

What I‚Äôm curious about (and haven‚Äôt seen mentioned so far) is whether backups will be included in certain donation tiers? Seems like a no-brainer to include backups as a benefit for being a monthly donor.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
justlurking:

whether backups will be included in certain donation tiers?

They won‚Äôt because they can‚Äôt be. Google/Apple app store rules don‚Äôt allow for ‚Äúdonation benefits‚Äù. A transaction can only be a donation or a payment for a service, not both.

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

Someone else already mentioned it, but if we do this, it would be putting our entire donation system in jeopardy. Google could claim that they‚Äôre no longer donations, but rather a service, and then we‚Äôd have to pay the Google tax on every donation. I honestly wish we could make it a donation perk, and it‚Äôs one of the things we initially wanted to do when planning the feature, but we just can‚Äôt risk it. I‚Äôm sorry, I know it‚Äôs frustrating to pay for an additional service when you‚Äôre already donating, and we appreciate the donation very much

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: dang, that‚Äôs a really tiny profit margin. which i mean makes sense for a nonprofit, but still. tiny.
I‚Äôm wondering now: wouldn‚Äôt it be an idea to have the possibility to pay the paid tier for somebody else as a gift? I‚Äôm thinking of supporting less well-off friends, things like that.
you can gift someone a badge, shouldn‚Äôt be hard to do the same for a paid tier.

posts.cooked: I think it‚Äôs a bit more complicated because the paid backup payment is via Play instead of Pay.

posts.name: Davide
posts.cooked:
Where will the data be stored?

Will it be stored by Signal on their infrastructure ( I guess in the United States), or by other storage providers?
I believe that Signal is run on AWS, so I would imagine that the back-ups are stored there as well.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: After the big outage in 2021, they diversified the infrastructure so that some parts are hosted on AWS, some on Google Cloud, and some on Azure.
